conclusion: Analyze current positions of shadows and influence of light source direction.
Shadow A is cast by the blue object.
Shadow B is cast by the egg.
Shadow C is cast by the typewriter.
Shadow D is cast by the small box.
Shadows are formed by blocking light; direction is opposite to light source.
Length of shadow depends on angle of light source relative to object.
Light source moving to back left causes shadows to shift right.
Shadows become longer as angle between light source and objects becomes more acute.
Light source moving to back right causes shadows to shift left.
Shadows become longer for same reason as moving light source to back left.
Shadows move away from objects opposite to new light source direction.
Shadows elongate due to increased angle between light source and objects.
If light source moves to back left, shadow A moves right and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back left, shadow B moves right and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back left, shadow C moves right and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back left, shadow D moves right and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back right, shadow A moves left and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back right, shadow B moves left and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back right, shadow C moves left and becomes longer.
If light source moves to back right, shadow D moves left and becomes longer.
